name: Sushi Rolls (Maki Sushi)
description: Traditional Japanese sushi rolls consisting of sushi rice, seaweed (nori), and various fillings such as fish, vegetables, or avocado.
steps: Cook sushi rice and season with sushi vinegar.
Spread the cooled rice on a sheet of nori laid out on a bamboo mat.
Place fillings like cucumber, avocado, and fish along the center of the rice.
Roll the nori tightly using the bamboo mat, pressing firmly.
Slice the roll into 6-8 pieces with a sharp knife.
ingredients: 200 grams fresh salmon or tuna, sliced
tips: Ensure the rice is at room temperature for easier handling.
Wet the knife slightly before slicing the rolls to prevent sticking.
Serve with soy sauce and a dab of wasabi.
